## Overview
Replace the incomplete/incorrect cloud-connectors integration with the production `vendor-connectors` PyPI package from jbcom ecosystem.

## Background
- PRs #183 and #185 attempted to extract cloud clients but used non-existent `cloud-connectors` package
- The correct package is `vendor-connectors` published to PyPI as `vendor-connectors>=202511.1`

## Tasks
- [ ] Update pyproject.toml to use `vendor-connectors` from PyPI
- [ ] Remove duplicate dependencies (boto3, hvac, slack-sdk, etc. - now provided by vendor-connectors)
- [ ] Delete obsolete client files (aws_client.py, github_client.py, etc.)
- [ ] Update imports from `cloud_connectors` to `vendor_connectors`
- [ ] Keep terraform-specific errors in terraform_modules/errors.py
- [ ] Update terraform_data_source.py imports
- [ ] Update terraform_null_resource.py imports
- [ ] Test tm_cli commands
- [ ] Verify all terraform module generation works

## Dependencies Provided by vendor-connectors
- extended-data-types (includes gitpython, inflection, lark, orjson, ruamel.yaml, sortedcontainers)
- lifecyclelogging
- directed-inputs-class
- boto3, hvac, google-api-python-client, slack-sdk, PyGithub, python-graphql-client
- google-cloud-billing, google-cloud-resource-manager
- validators, deepmerge, filelock, more-itertools, requests

## Related
- Supersedes PR #183 and PR #185
- Part of jbcom ecosystem integration

## Overview
Move deepmerge functionality to extended-data-types as a core utility, with proxy methods in terraform_data_source.py.

## Rationale
- deepmerge is used by secrets merging pipeline
- It's a general-purpose utility that belongs in extended-data-types

- [ ] Update imports in terraform_modules
- [ ] Release patch to extended-data-types
- [ ] Update vendor-connectors dependency version

## Integration Points
- secrets-merging Lambda uses deepmerge
- terraform_data_source has deepmerge method
- Both should use the same underlying implementation

content.body:
## Overview
The terraform data source wrappers for listing Vault and AWS secrets are only used by the secrets pipeline lambdas. These should be core functionality in vendor-connectors, not terraform wrappers.

## Current State
- `list_vault_secrets` in terraform_data_source.py - terraform wrapper
- `list_aws_account_secrets` in terraform_data_source.py - terraform wrapper
- Called via terraform external data sources from secrets workspace
- Only used by secrets-merging pipeline

## Target State
- Move secret listing to VaultConnector and AWSConnector in vendor-connectors
- Lambdas call vendor-connectors directly (no terraform)
- Remove terraform wrapper methods from terraform_data_source.py
- Simpler, more direct architecture

## Tasks
- [ ] Add `list_secrets()` to VaultConnector in vendor-connectors
- [ ] Add `list_secrets()` to AWSConnector in vendor-connectors
- [ ] Update secrets-merging lambda to use vendor-connectors directly
- [ ] Remove terraform wrapper methods from terraform_data_source.py
- [ ] Release patch to vendor-connectors
- [ ] Update terraform-aws-secretsmanager to use new architecture

## Benefits
- Simpler architecture (no terraform indirection for lambda-only features)
- Cleaner separation of concerns
- Easier testing and debugging
- Reduced complexity in terraform_data_source.py

cc @jbcom

content.body:
## Overview
Create a proper sync mechanism for enterprise secrets using SOPS files as the source of truth.

## Background
- Current approach using `toJson(secrets)` in GitHub Actions has visibility restrictions
- `EXTERNAL_CI_BOT_SSH_PRIVATE_KEY` has PRIVATE visibility and isn't accessible
- The proper solution is to read from SOPS-encrypted source files using AWS KMS

## Proposed Solution
1. Create JavaScript GitHub Action in org-admin repo
2. Use `sops-decoder` npm package to decrypt SOPS files
3. Use `libsodium-wrappers` for GitHub secret encryption
4. Same AWS auth pattern as generator/secrets jobs

## Files Created (in progress)
- `.github/actions/sync-enterprise-secrets/` (JavaScript action)
- `.github/workflows/sync-enterprise-secrets.yml`

## Target Organizations
- fsc-internal-tooling-administration
- (other enterprise orgs as needed)

## References
- Recovered from background agent session bc-c1254c3f-ea3a-43a9-a958-13e921226f5d
- See memory-bank/activeContext.md for architecture diagram

cc @jbcom

content.body:
## Summary

This PR introduces **agentic-control** - a new public npm package that unifies all AI agent tooling under one production-grade package. This addresses the request to formalize agentic management processes across both jbcom and FlipsideCrypto organizations.

### Key Features

- **ğŸ” Intelligent Token Switching**
  - Automatically selects `GITHUB_FSC_TOKEN` for FlipsideCrypto repos
  - Automatically selects `GITHUB_JBCOM_TOKEN` for jbcom repos
  - PR reviews ALWAYS use consistent identity (`GITHUB_JBCOM_TOKEN`)
  - Extensible via environment variables (`AGENTIC_ORG_<NAME>_TOKEN`)

- **ğŸš€ Fleet Management** (from cursor-fleet)
  - Spawn, monitor, and coordinate Cursor Background Agents
  - Diamond pattern orchestration
  - Bidirectional coordination via PR comments
  - **Now supports explicit model specification** (`--model claude-sonnet-4-20250514`)

- **ğŸ” AI-Powered Triage** (from ai-triage)
  - Conversation analysis
  - Code review
  - Task extraction
  - Issue creation with Copilot labels

- **ğŸ¤ Handoff Protocol**
  - Station-to-station agent continuity
  - Context preservation
  - PR takeover automation

### Package Structure

```
packages/agentic-control/
â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ core/       # Types, tokens, config
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fleet/      # Cursor agent management  
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ triage/     # AI analysis
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ github/     # Multi-org GitHub client
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ handoff/    # Agent handoff protocols
â””â”€â”€ tests/          # 19 passing tests
```

### CLI Commands

```bash
# Token management
agentic tokens status
agentic tokens validate
agentic tokens for-repo FlipsideCrypto/repo

# Fleet management  
agentic fleet list --running
agentic fleet spawn <repo> <task> --model claude-sonnet-4-20250514
agentic fleet coordinate --pr 123

# AI Triage
agentic triage quick "error message"
agentic triage review --base main
agentic triage analyze <agent-id> --create-issues

# Handoff
agentic handoff initiate <id> --pr 123 --branch my-branch
```

### Dockerfile Updates

Added globally-installed tools for future agent sessions:
- `@intellectronica/ruler` - AI agent instruction management
- `@anthropic-ai/claude-code` - Anthropic's AI coding CLI
- Verification step for all tools

## Test Plan

- [x] 19 token management tests pass
- [x] Package builds successfully (`pnpm run build`)
- [ ] Manual testing of CLI commands
- [ ] Integration with fsc-control-center

## Related

- Holding PR: #284
- Addresses: Formalization of agentic processes across jbcom + FlipsideCrypto

## Migration Path

1. Deprecate `@jbcom/cursor-fleet` and `@jbcom/ai-triage`
2. Update fsc-control-center to use `agentic-control`
3. Publish to npm as public package

---
*Part of the unified agentic platform work*

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Introduces the agentic-control package providing a unified CLI and SDK for multi-org token-aware GitHub ops, Cursor agent fleet management, AI triage, and station-to-station handoff, plus Docker image tooling updates.
> 
> - **agentic-control (new package)**
>   - **CLI (`src/cli.ts`)**: Commands for `tokens`, `fleet` (list/spawn/followup/summary/coordinate), `triage` (quick/review/analyze), `handoff` (initiate/confirm/takeover), and `config`.
>   - **Core**: `config.ts` (env/file config, defaults, logging), `tokens.ts` (intelligent multi-org token switching, PR-review identity), `types.ts`, `index.ts` exports.
>   - **Fleet**: `cursor-api.ts` (direct Cursor API client with validation/error handling), `fleet.ts` (spawn with model, monitor, archive, diamond orchestration, PR-based coordination), `index.ts`.
>   - **AI Triage**: `analyzer.ts` (Claude-based conversation analysis, code review, quick triage, GitHub issue creation using PR-review token), `index.ts`.
>   - **GitHub**: `client.ts` (token-aware Octokit wrapper, PR ops, gh helpers), `index.ts`.
>   - **Handoff**: `manager.ts` (initiate/confirm/takeover with PR merge/branch flow), `index.ts`.
>   - **Project setup**: `package.json` (build/test/bin/exports), `tsconfig.json`, `.gitignore`, `README.md` with usage, tests for token logic.
> - **Dockerfile**: Add global CLIs (`@intellectronica/ruler`, `@anthropic-ai/claude-code`) and a verification step; keep `aider` via uv-managed Python 3.12.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 2eeb569f306aea21f0e4d0f7f2784deb08be4aba. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

content.body:
## Context

This issue tracks the resolution of **muddled scope and ownership boundaries** across the jbcom agentic ecosystem, as flagged in [agentic-control PR #7](https://github.com/jbcom/agentic-control/pull/7#issuecomment-3621528331).

## Problem Statement

The current repository structure has **competing concerns** that create confusion:

| Repository | Current State | Issue |
|------------|---------------|-------|
| `agentic-control` | Node.js + Python (CrewAI), Cursor API client, Claude SDK | Has vendor-specific code that belongs elsewhere |
| `vendor-connectors` | AWS, GitHub, Google, Slack, Vault, Zoom connectors | **Missing** Cursor and Anthropic connectors |
| `jbcom-control-center` | Orchestration layer | Needs to track this refactor |

### Specific Problems Identified

1. **`cursor-api.ts`** in `agentic-control` is a vendor-specific API client that belongs in `vendor-connectors`
2. **`@anthropic-ai/claude-agent-sdk`** usage is vendor-specific - should be abstracted
3. **CrewAI code** in `agentic-control/python/` is a specific orchestration framework - potentially separate concern
4. **No clear protocol definition** for how agents register with and communicate through agentic-control
5. **No separation** between "what vendors provide" vs "what agentic-control orchestrates"

## Target Architecture

content.body:
## Context

This issue is part of the [Agentic Ecosystem Scope Clarification Epic](https://github.com/jbcom/jbcom-control-center/issues/340), which addresses muddled boundaries across repositories.

## Background

Currently, `agentic-control` contains vendor-specific code that belongs in `vendor-connectors`:

1. **Cursor API client** (`cursor-api.ts`) - ~300 lines of well-structured TypeScript code for the Cursor Background Agent API
2. **Anthropic Claude Agent SDK** usage - direct dependency that should be abstracted

This issue tracks adding these as proper vendor connectors.

## Requirements

### 1. Cursor Connector

Port the Cursor API client from `agentic-control/src/fleet/cursor-api.ts` to a Python implementation:

**Features to implement:**
- [ ] Agent management (list, get status, get conversation)
- [ ] Agent launching with prompt/source/target/webhook options
- [ ] Follow-up messages to agents
- [ ] Repository listing
- [ ] Model listing
- [ ] Input validation (agent ID, prompt text, repository, webhook URL)
- [ ] SSRF protection for webhook URLs
- [ ] Error sanitization (prevent credential leakage)
- [ ] Timeout handling

**Reference implementation:**
```typescript
// From agentic-control/src/fleet/cursor-api.ts
export class CursorAPI {
    async listAgents(): Promise<Result<Agent[]>>
    async getAgentStatus(agentId: string): Promise<Result<Agent>>
    async getAgentConversation(agentId: string): Promise<Result<Conversation>>
    async launchAgent(options: LaunchOptions): Promise<Result<Agent>>
    async addFollowup(agentId: string, prompt: { text: string }): Promise<Result<void>>
    async listRepositories(): Promise<Result<Repository[]>>
    async listModels(): Promise<Result<string[]>>
}
```

**Python interface (proposed):**
```python
from vendor_connectors.cursor import CursorConnector

connector = CursorConnector(api_key="...")
agents = await connector.list_agents()
agent = await connector.launch_agent(
    prompt="Implement feature X",
    repository="org/repo",
    ref="main"
)
```

### 2. Anthropic Connector

Wrap the Anthropic Claude Agent SDK for consistent interface:

**Features to implement:**
- [ ] Claude Agent SDK wrapper
- [ ] Sandbox execution mode (local single-agent)
- [ ] Consistent error handling
- [ ] Configuration management (API keys, model selection)

**Python interface (proposed):**
```python
from vendor_connectors.anthropic import AnthropicConnector

connector = AnthropicConnector(api_key="...")
result = await connector.execute_task(
    task="Implement feature X",
    working_dir="/path/to/repo"
)
```

## File Structure

```
src/vendor_connectors/
â”œâ”€â”€ cursor/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ client.py          # Main API client
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ models.py          # Pydantic models (Agent, Repository, etc.)
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ validators.py      # Input validation
â”œâ”€â”€ anthropic/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ client.py          # Claude SDK wrapper
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ sandbox.py         # Sandbox execution mode
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ models.py          # Response models
â””â”€â”€ __init__.py            # Export all connectors
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Cursor connector implemented with full API coverage
- [ ] Anthropic connector implemented with sandbox execution
- [ ] Tests for both connectors
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] CI passes
- [ ] Published to PyPI

## Related Issues

- Epic: jbcom/jbcom-control-center#340
- Upstream: jbcom/agentic-control (will consume these connectors)

## Labels

`enhancement`, `connector`, `cursor`, `anthropic`

content.body:
## Context

This issue is part of the [Agentic Ecosystem Scope Clarification Epic](https://github.com/jbcom/jbcom-control-center/issues/340), as flagged in [PR #7 comment](https://github.com/jbcom/agentic-control/pull/7#issuecomment-3621528331).

## Problem Statement

`agentic-control` currently has **muddled scope** with vendor-specific code mixed into what should be a vendor-agnostic protocol layer:

| File | Issue |
|------|-------|
| `src/fleet/cursor-api.ts` | Vendor-specific Cursor API client |
| `@anthropic-ai/claude-agent-sdk` dependency | Vendor-specific SDK |
| `python/` directory | CrewAI-specific code (different orchestration concern) |

## Target State

`agentic-control` should be the **protocol layer** that:
1. Defines HOW agents register and communicate
2. Provides fleet management PROTOCOLS (not implementations)
3. Uses `vendor-connectors` for vendor-specific API calls
4. Is agnostic to whether you use Cursor, Anthropic, CrewAI, or others

## Architecture After Refactor

```
agentic-control/
â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ core/              # âœ… KEEP - Core types and interfaces
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ types.ts
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ protocols.ts   # â† NEW: Define agent protocols
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ fleet/             # ğŸ”„ REFACTOR
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ index.ts       # Fleet protocols (vendor-agnostic)
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ provider.ts    # Provider interface
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ registry.ts    # Provider registry
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ providers/         # â† NEW: Provider implementations
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ cursor.ts      # Uses @jbcom/vendor-connectors-cursor
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ anthropic.ts   # Uses @jbcom/vendor-connectors-anthropic
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ triage/            # âœ… KEEP
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ handoff/           # âœ… KEEP
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ github/            # âœ… KEEP
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ cli.ts             # âœ… KEEP
â””â”€â”€ package.json           # Remove direct vendor SDK deps
```

## Tasks

### Phase 1: Define Protocols
- [ ] Create `src/core/protocols.ts` with formal agent protocols:
  - Agent registration protocol
  - Agent-to-agent communication protocol
  - Fleet status protocol
  - Task delegation protocol

### Phase 2: Create Provider Interface
- [ ] Define `IAgentProvider` interface in `src/fleet/provider.ts`
- [ ] Define `IFleetProvider` interface for fleet operations
- [ ] Create provider registry for multiple backends

### Phase 3: Extract Vendor Code
- [ ] Move `cursor-api.ts` logic to `vendor-connectors` (see jbcom/vendor-connectors#XX)
- [ ] Create `src/providers/cursor.ts` that uses vendor-connectors
- [ ] Create `src/providers/anthropic.ts` that uses vendor-connectors
- [ ] Remove direct `@anthropic-ai/claude-agent-sdk` dependency

### Phase 4: Extract CrewAI
- [ ] Move `python/` directory to new `agentic-crew` repository
- [ ] Create bridge documentation for CrewAI integration

### Phase 5: Documentation
- [ ] Update README with clear scope definition
- [ ] Document provider interface for new implementations
- [ ] Document agent registration protocol
- [ ] Update ARCHITECTURE.md

## Protocol Definitions (Draft)

### Agent Registration Protocol
```typescript
interface AgentRegistration {
    agentId: string;
    capabilities: string[];
    provider: string;
    endpoint: string;
    authentication: AuthMethod;
}

interface AgentRegistryProtocol {
    register(registration: AgentRegistration): Promise<void>;
    deregister(agentId: string): Promise<void>;
    discover(capabilities: string[]): Promise<Agent[]>;
}
```

### Agent Communication Protocol
```typescript
interface AgentMessage {
    from: string;
    to: string;
    type: 'task' | 'status' | 'handoff' | 'triage';
    payload: unknown;
    correlationId: string;
}

interface AgentCommunicationProtocol {
    send(message: AgentMessage): Promise<void>;
    subscribe(agentId: string, handler: MessageHandler): void;
}
```

## Success Criteria

- [ ] No vendor-specific code in core modules
- [ ] Clear provider interface documented
- [ ] Protocol definitions formalized
- [ ] Works with Cursor (remote multi-agent) as default
- [ ] Works with Anthropic (local single-agent) as default
- [ ] Extensible to other providers (CrewAI, custom)

## Related Issues

- Epic: jbcom/jbcom-control-center#340
- Vendor Connectors: jbcom/vendor-connectors (Cursor + Anthropic connectors)
- CrewAI: Will be moved to new `agentic-crew` repository

## Labels

`refactor`, `architecture`, `breaking-change`

content.body:
## Overview

Create a unified AI sub-package that leverages LangChain/LangGraph for:
1. **Multi-provider AI access** (Anthropic, OpenAI, Google, xAI, Ollama)
2. **Tool abstraction** - expose existing vendor connectors as AI-callable tools
3. **Tracing/observability** via LangSmith

This enables agentic workflows where AI can call AWS, GitHub, Slack, Vault, etc. as tools.

## Proposed Architecture

```
vendor_connectors/
â”œâ”€â”€ ai/                          # NEW: AI sub-package
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ base.py                  # Base AI interface
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ providers/               # LangChain-based AI providers
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ base.py              # LangChain wrapper base
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ anthropic.py         # Claude via LangChain
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ openai.py            # GPT via LangChain
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ google.py            # Gemini via LangChain
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ xai.py               # Grok via LangChain
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ ollama.py            # Local models via LangChain
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ tools/                   # Vendor connectors as AI tools
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ base.py              # Tool registration/discovery
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ aws_tools.py         # S3, Secrets, Lambda as tools
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ github_tools.py      # PR, Issues, Files as tools
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ slack_tools.py       # Messages, Channels as tools
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ vault_tools.py       # Secrets management as tools
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ cursor_tools.py      # Agent management as tools
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ google_tools.py      # GCP operations as tools
â”œâ”€â”€ anthropic/                   # Keep for backwards compat (wraps ai.providers)
â”œâ”€â”€ cursor/                      # Keep - unique API, not an AI provider
â””â”€â”€ [existing connectors...]
```

## Benefits

### 1. Unified AI Interface
```python
from vendor_connectors.ai import AIConnector

# Same interface, different providers
ai = AIConnector(provider="anthropic")  # or "openai", "google", "ollama"
response = ai.chat("Explain this code")
```

### 2. Tools from Existing Connectors
```python
from vendor_connectors.ai.tools import get_all_tools

# All vendor connectors become AI tools
tools = get_all_tools()
# Returns: [GitHubCreatePRTool, SlackSendMessageTool, S3UploadTool, ...]

# Use with LangChain agent
from langchain.agents import create_tool_calling_agent
agent = create_tool_calling_agent(llm, tools, prompt)
```

### 3. LangGraph Workflows
```python
from vendor_connectors.ai import create_workflow

# Declarative multi-step workflows
workflow = create_workflow([
    ("analyze", "Review this PR for security issues"),
    ("report", "Post findings to Slack #security"),
    ("create_issue", "Create GitHub issue if critical"),
])
```

### 4. Observability via LangSmith
```python
from vendor_connectors.ai import AIConnector

ai = AIConnector(
    provider="anthropic",
    langsmith_api_key="...",  # Optional tracing
)
```

## Dependencies

```toml
[project.optional-dependencies]
ai = [
    "langchain>=0.3.0",
    "langchain-anthropic>=0.3.0",
    "langchain-openai>=0.3.0",
    "langchain-google-genai>=2.0.0",
    "langchain-ollama>=0.2.0",
    "langgraph>=0.2.0",
]
ai-observability = [
    "langsmith>=0.2.0",
]
```

## Migration Path

1. **Phase 1**: Create `ai/` sub-package structure
2. **Phase 2**: Implement LangChain providers
3. **Phase 3**: Create tools from existing connectors
4. **Phase 4**: Add LangGraph workflow support
5. **Phase 5**: Deprecate direct `anthropic/` module (keep for compat)

## Relation to agentic-control

Once this is implemented:
- `agentic-control` uses `vendor_connectors.ai` for all AI operations
- `agentic-control` becomes purely a protocol/orchestration layer
- Tools are provided by `vendor_connectors.ai.tools`

## Related Issues

- Epic: jbcom/jbcom-control-center#340
- Current Anthropic PR: #16

## Labels

`enhancement`, `architecture`, `ai`, `langchain`

content.body:
## Overview

Add a connector for [Meshy](https://meshy.ai) - AI-powered 3D asset generation.

## Use Case: Otterfall

The `jbcom/otterfall` game project has a CrewAI `asset_pipeline` crew that needs to call Meshy's API:

```yaml
# From otterfall/.crewai/crews/asset_pipeline/agents.yaml
prompt_engineer:
  role: Meshy Prompt Engineer
  goal: >
    Craft prompts that produce high-quality, game-ready 3D models
    from Meshy's text-to-3D API.
```

Currently the crew defines prompts but has no tool to execute them.

## Proposed API

```python
from vendor_connectors.meshy import MeshyConnector

meshy = MeshyConnector()  # Uses MESHY_API_KEY

# Text to 3D
result = meshy.text_to_3d(
    prompt="A realistic river otter, quadruped, detailed fur texture",
    art_style="realistic",
    topology_type="quad",  # or "tris"
    target_polycount=5000,
)

# Image to 3D
result = meshy.image_to_3d(
    image_url="https://...",
    topology_type="quad",
)

# Check status
status = meshy.get_task(result.task_id)

# Download result
model = meshy.download_model(result.task_id, format="glb")
```

## AI Tool Export

Once implemented, `vendor_connectors.ai.tools` will auto-generate:
- `MeshyTextTo3DTool` - Generate 3D from text prompt
- `MeshyImageTo3DTool` - Generate 3D from image
- `MeshyGetTaskTool` - Check generation status
- `MeshyDownloadTool` - Download generated model

## Integration with Otterfall

```python
# In asset_pipeline crew
from vendor_connectors.ai.tools import get_tools

tools = get_tools(["meshy.*"])

prompt_engineer = Agent(
    role="Meshy Prompt Engineer",
    tools=[tools.meshy_text_to_3d, tools.meshy_get_task],
    ...
)
```

## Meshy API Reference

- Docs: https://docs.meshy.ai
- Endpoints:
  - POST `/v2/text-to-3d` - Text-to-3D generation
  - POST `/v2/image-to-3d` - Image-to-3D generation
  - GET `/v2/text-to-3d/{id}` - Get task status
  - GET `/v2/image-to-3d/{id}` - Get task status

## Priority

**High** - This is a concrete use case that validates the entire ecosystem architecture:
1. vendor-connectors provides the API client
2. vendor_connectors.ai.tools exports as AI tool
3. agentic-crew (via otterfall's .crewai) uses the tool
4. agentic-control orchestrates via Cursor fleet for CI/CD

## Related

- Epic: jbcom/jbcom-control-center#340
- AI Sub-Package: #17
- agentic-crew: jbcom/jbcom-control-center#342
- Consumer: jbcom/otterfall

## Summary

Create a `connector_builder` crew that can automatically generate HTTP connector code by scraping API documentation.

## Use Case

Instead of manually writing HTTP connectors for vendor-connectors:
1. Point the crew at API documentation (e.g., `https://docs.meshy.ai/en`)
2. Crew scrapes and analyzes API structure
3. Crew generates typed Python HTTP client code
4. Human reviews and integrates

## Crew Architecture

```
â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
â”‚                 connector_builder Crew                          â”‚
â”‚                                                                  â”‚
â”‚  â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”    â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”    â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚
â”‚  â”‚  Doc Scraper  â”‚ â†’ â”‚  API Analyzer     â”‚ â†’ â”‚ Code Generatorâ”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â”‚   Agent       â”‚    â”‚   Agent          â”‚    â”‚   Agent       â”‚ â”‚
â”‚  â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜    â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜    â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚
â”‚         â”‚                      â”‚                      â”‚        â”‚
â”‚         â–¼                      â–¼                      â–¼        â”‚
â”‚  ScrapeWebsiteTool      StructuredOutput       FileWriteTool  â”‚
â”‚  CrawlWebsiteTool                                              â”‚
â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
```

## Implementation Tasks

### 1. Create Crew Directory
```
src/agentic_crew/crews/connector_builder/
â”œâ”€â”€ config/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ agents.yaml
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ tasks.yaml
â””â”€â”€ connector_builder_crew.py
```

### 2. Define Agents

**doc_scraper**
- Role: API Documentation Scraper
- Tools: ScrapeWebsiteTool, CrawlWebsiteTool
- Goal: Extract endpoint information from docs

**api_analyzer**
- Role: API Structure Analyst
- Goal: Create structured API representation

**code_generator**
- Role: Python HTTP Client Generator
- Tools: FileWriteTool
- Goal: Generate vendor-connectors compatible code

### 3. Define Tasks

1. `scrape_docs` - Crawl API documentation
2. `analyze_api` - Extract endpoint structure
3. `generate_code` - Write Python connector

### 4. Add Scraping Tools
- Integrate CrewAI's `ScrapeWebsiteTool`
- Add custom `CrawlWebsiteTool` for multi-page docs

## Output Structure

```
{output_dir}/
â”œâ”€â”€ models.py       # Pydantic models
â”œâ”€â”€ client.py       # HTTP client
â”œâ”€â”€ exceptions.py   # Custom exceptions
â””â”€â”€ __init__.py     # Public API
```

## Testing

- Test with Meshy docs: `https://docs.meshy.ai/en`
- Validate generated code with ruff/mypy
- Compare to manually written connector

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Crew defined in YAML
- [ ] Scraping tools integrated
- [ ] Generates valid Python code
- [ ] Output follows vendor-connectors patterns
- [ ] E2E test with real API docs

## Related

- Epic: jbcom/agentic-crew#2
- vendor-connectors integration

content.body:
## Summary

Set up the integration between agentic-crew and vendor-connectors to enable:
1. Using connector_builder crew to generate HTTP connectors
2. vendor-connectors using agentic-crew for AI agent tooling

## Integration Points

### 1. connector_builder â†’ vendor-connectors

The `connector_builder` crew in agentic-crew generates HTTP connector code that can be integrated into vendor-connectors.

**Workflow:**
```
1. Run: agentic-crew run agentic-crew connector_builder --input '{"api_docs_url": "https://docs.meshy.ai/en"}'
2. Review generated code in /tmp/connector-output/
3. Copy to vendor-connectors/src/vendor_connectors/{vendor}/
4. Add tests and documentation
5. PR to vendor-connectors
```

### 2. vendor-connectors â†’ agentic-crew (Development)

vendor-connectors can use agentic-crew for development workflows:

**`.crewai/manifest.yaml` in vendor-connectors:**
```yaml
name: vendor-connectors
version: "1.0"

llm:
  provider: anthropic
  model: claude-sonnet-4-20250514

crews:
  connector_generator:
    description: Generate new vendor connector from API docs
    # References agentic-crew's connector_builder
    extends: agentic-crew:connector_builder
```

### 3. Tool Sharing

vendor-connectors provides HTTP tools that agentic-crew crews can use:
- `meshy_text3d_generate` - Generate 3D models
- `meshy_animate` - Apply animations
- etc.

**Registration:**
```python
from vendor_connectors.meshy.tools import get_tools

# Get tools in framework-native format
tools = get_tools(framework="crewai")
```

## Tasks

- [ ] Add `agentic-crew` as dev dependency in vendor-connectors
- [ ] Create `.crewai/` directory in vendor-connectors
- [ ] Document connector generation workflow
- [ ] Test connector generation with Meshy docs
- [ ] Add generated connector validation tests

## Dependencies

- jbcom/vendor-connectors#37 - connector_builder crew implementation

## Related

- vendor-connectors issues jbdevprimary/vendor-connectors#17, jbdevprimary/vendor-connectors#18, jbdevprimary/vendor-connectors#33

content.body:
## Summary

This PR adds the core capability that makes agentic-crew truly framework-agnostic: **declare crews once, run them on CrewAI, LangGraph, or Strands**.

### Key Changes

- **Framework Decomposition** (`core/decomposer.py`)
  - Auto-detect installed frameworks
  - Select best available (priority: CrewAI > LangGraph > Strands)
  - Runtime framework selection (no framework required at install time)

- **Runner Architecture** (`runners/`)
  - `base.py`: Abstract interface all runners implement
  - `crewai_runner.py`: Full CrewAI integration
  - `langgraph_runner.py`: LangGraph/LangChain integration
  - `strands_runner.py`: AWS Strands integration

- **Comprehensive Documentation**
  - `AGENTS.md`: Complete agent bootstrap documentation
  - `.github/agents/`: Specialized agent instructions
    - `runner-developer.md`: Framework runner implementation
    - `crew-builder.md`: Crew definition guidance
    - `documentation.md`: Docs maintenance
    - `test-runner.md`: Testing guidelines
    - `connector-builder.md`: HTTP connector generation
  - `.cursor/rules/`: Cursor-specific rules
    - `00-fundamentals.mdc`: Core development workflow
    - `01-architecture.mdc`: Framework decomposition
    - `02-python.mdc`: Python coding standards
    - `03-testing.mdc`: Test patterns and coverage
    - `04-pr-workflow.mdc`: PR workflow
    - `05-crews.mdc`: Crew definition guidelines
  - `.github/copilot-instructions.md`: Copilot guidance
  - `.github/copilot-space.yml`: Copilot context
  - `CLAUDE.md`: Claude-specific guidance

- **CI/CD & Infrastructure**
  - `.github/workflows/ci.yml`: Build, test, lint, release
  - `.github/workflows/codeql.yml`: Security analysis
  - `.cursor/Dockerfile`: Development container
  - `.cursor/environment.json`: Cursor environment

- **Optional Dependencies**
  - Core package has NO framework dependencies
  - Install what you need: `pip install agentic-crew[crewai]`
  - Or all: `pip install agentic-crew[ai]`

### Architecture

```
manifest.yaml â†’ Loader â†’ Decomposer â†’ Runner
                              â”‚
              â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¼â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
              â–¼               â–¼               â–¼
          CrewAI          LangGraph        Strands
```

### Usage

```python
from agentic_crew import run_crew

# Auto-detects best framework
result = run_crew("my-package", "my_crew", inputs={"task": "..."})
```

### Why This Matters

1. **No vendor lock-in**: Switch frameworks without rewriting crews
2. **Gradual adoption**: Start with one framework, add others later
3. **CI flexibility**: Different frameworks for different environments
4. **Future-proof**: New frameworks can be added as runners
5. **Documentation-first**: AI agents can immediately understand and contribute

## Test Plan

- [ ] Unit tests for decomposer
- [ ] Integration tests for each runner
- [ ] E2E test with actual crew execution
- [ ] Test framework fallback when one is missing

## Next Steps (for follow-up PRs)

1. Add `connector_builder` crew for vendor-connectors integration
2. Add web scraping tools (ScrapeWebsiteTool)
3. Comprehensive test suite
4. CLI improvements

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Introduces auto-detected, framework-agnostic runner architecture with CrewAI/LangGraph/Strands implementations, plus documentation, CI, and packaging updates.
> 
> - **Core**:
>   - `core/decomposer.py`: Auto-detects available frameworks, selects runner, and provides build/run helpers.
>   - `runners/`: Adds `base.py` interface and implementations `crewai_runner.py`, `langgraph_runner.py`, `strands_runner.py`, plus `__init__.py` export.
> - **Packaging**:
>   - `pyproject.toml`: Version bump to `0.2.0`; adds optional extras (`crewai`, `langgraph`, `strands`, `ai`, `scraping`, etc.), test/dev tooling, coverage, and semantic-release config; scripts wired.
> - **Docs**:
>   - Adds `AGENTS.md`, `CLAUDE.md`, `.github/agents/*`, `.cursor/rules/*`, Copilot instructions/space, README overhaul, and memory-bank context.
> - **CI/CD & Dev Env**:
>   - GitHub Actions: `ci.yml` (build/test/lint/release) and `codeql.yml`.
>   - Dev container: `.cursor/Dockerfile` and `.cursor/environment.json` for local tooling (pnpm, playwright, process-compose).
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 1619dc2f1dd8f9d26b006e1586160d6537d7c5a1. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

## Summary

Integrate vendor-connectors with [agentic-crew](https://github.com/jbcom/agentic-crew) for AI workflow orchestration.

## Background

Per the architectural decision, vendor-connectors focuses on **HTTP connectivity** while agentic-crew handles **AI crew orchestration**. This issue tracks the integration between the two.

## Integration Points

### 1. Tool Export Pattern

Each connector can export framework-specific tools:

```python
# vendor_connectors/meshy/tools.py (IMPLEMENTED)
def get_tools(framework: str = "auto") -> list:
    """Get tools in native format for the detected framework."""

def get_langchain_tools() -> list:
    """Get LangChain StructuredTools."""

def get_crewai_tools() -> list:
    """Get CrewAI-native tools."""

def get_strands_tools() -> list:
    """Get Strands-compatible functions."""
```

### 2. .crewai/ Directory for Development Workflows

Add `.crewai/` directory to vendor-connectors for connector generation:

```yaml
# .crewai/manifest.yaml
name: vendor-connectors
version: "1.0"

crews:
  connector_generator:
    description: Generate new HTTP connector from API docs
    # Uses agentic-crew's connector_builder crew
```

### 3. Dev Dependency

```toml
# pyproject.toml
[project.optional-dependencies]
dev = [
    "agentic-crew[crewai,scraping]",  # For connector generation
]
```

## Tasks

- [x] Implement tool export pattern in Meshy connector
- [ ] Apply pattern to other connectors (AWS, GitHub, etc.)
- [ ] Add `.crewai/` directory for development workflows
- [ ] Document connector generation workflow
- [ ] Add `agentic-crew` as dev dependency
- [ ] Test end-to-end connector generation

## Related

- agentic-crew repo: https://github.com/jbcom/agentic-crew
- agentic-crew PR #1: Framework decomposition
- agentic-crew issue #5: connector_builder crew
- agentic-crew issue #8: vendor-connectors integration
- Issue #17: AI sub-package (superseded by this approach)
- Issue #33: AI tooling restructure (partially addressed)

content.body:
## Summary

Fixes test generation being skipped when workflow inputs are unset (null).

### Root Cause
The `generate` and other jobs were skipped because:
- `inputs.dry_run == false` evaluates to `false` when `inputs.dry_run` is `null` (unset)
- `inputs.auto_fix_tests == true` evaluates to `false` when null (but default is true)
- `inputs.use_pyproject_coverage == false` evaluates to `false` when null

### Fix
Changed all boolean input comparisons to use negation patterns that correctly handle null:
- `inputs.dry_run != true` (runs when null or false)
- `inputs.auto_fix_tests != false` (runs when null or true)
- `inputs.use_pyproject_coverage != true` (runs when null or false)

### CI Validation
Added comprehensive CI workflow (`ci.yml`) that:
- Lints all workflow files with actionlint
- **Prevents this bug from recurring** by detecting dangerous `inputs.X == false/true` patterns
- Validates sync.yml configuration
- Validates repository-files structure
- Dry-run tests the module discovery logic

## Test Plan
- [x] Verified expression logic with Node.js evaluation tests
- [x] Validated no dangerous patterns remain in workflows
- [x] All workflows pass actionlint
- [x] CI workflow validates itself

## Verification
```javascript
// OLD: null == false â†’ false (BROKEN - job skipped)
// NEW: null != true â†’ true (CORRECT - job runs)
```

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Fixes boolean input handling in `generate-tests.yml` and adds a new CI workflow that lints and validates workflows, sync config, repo files, and test discovery logic.
> 
> - **Workflows**:
>   - **`generate-tests.yml`**:
>     - Replace brittle boolean checks with null-safe conditions:
>       - `inputs.dry_run != true`
>       - `inputs.auto_fix_tests != false`
>       - `inputs.use_pyproject_coverage != true`
>     - Applied to `generate`, `consolidate`, `auto-fix`, and `update-pyproject` job `if:` conditions.
>   - **`ci.yml` (new)**:
>     - Lints workflows with `actionlint`.
>     - Scans for dangerous patterns (`inputs.X == false/true`) and verifies expression behavior.
>     - Validates `.github/sync.yml` (YAML + referenced source paths exist).
>     - Validates `repository-files` structure and non-empty cursor rules.
>     - Dry-runs module discovery logic used by test generation.
>     - Produces a summary and fails if any check fails.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit bbe8043f0d3d259d0a1c8f5632f386cede145a1d. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

content.body:
The `vendor_connectors.ai` package created unnecessary indirection by centralizing tools, provider wrappers, and workflows. Each connector should own its tools rather than route through a central package.

## Changes

**Moved Meshy tools to `meshy/` package**
- `meshy/tools.py` - LangChain StructuredTools (8 tools: text3d_generate, image3d_generate, rig_model, etc.)
- `meshy/mcp.py` - MCP server implementation
- Updated entry point: `meshy-mcp` â†’ `vendor_connectors.meshy.mcp:main`

**Deleted AI package infrastructure** (~5,700 lines)
- Removed `ai/connector.py` (AIConnector wrapper)
- Removed `ai/providers/` (BaseLLMProvider, anthropic.py, openai.py, google.py, ollama.py, xai.py)
- Removed `ai/tools/` (factory.py, registry.py, stub files)
- Removed `ai/workflows/` (builder.py, nodes.py)
- Removed `tests/ai/` (7 test files)

**Simplified dependencies**
- Made `langchain-core` required (not optional) - we provide tools, users choose LLM providers
- Removed `meshy-langchain` extra (redundant)
- Kept `meshy-crewai`, `meshy-mcp` for optional frameworks

## Pattern: Three Interfaces Per Connector

```python
# 1. Direct Python API
from vendor_connectors.meshy import text3d
model = text3d.generate("a sword")

# 2. LangChain tools (works with LangChain, CrewAI, LangGraph, etc.)
from vendor_connectors.meshy.tools import get_tools
tools = get_tools()  # Standard StructuredTools

# 3. MCP server
meshy-mcp  # Command line
```

All interfaces automatically load secrets via `DirectedInputsClass` (env vars, config files, direct params).

## Breaking Changes

- `vendor_connectors.ai` package removed
- Old: `from vendor_connectors.ai.tools.meshy_tools import get_meshy_tools`
- New: `from vendor_connectors.meshy.tools import get_tools`
- `langchain-core` now required dependency

## Impact

- Net: -4,343 lines (-76%)
- Tests: 19 passing (was 17 passing, 2 skipped)

<!-- START COPILOT ORIGINAL PROMPT -->



<details>

<summary>Original prompt</summary>


----

*This section details on the original issue you should resolve*

<issue_title>refactor(ai): restructure AI tooling - each connector should own its tools</issue_title>
<issue_description>## Summary

The current `vendor_connectors/ai/` subpackage is over-engineered and creates unnecessary indirection. Each vendor connector should own its own LangChain tools and MCP implementation rather than having a central AI package.

## Current Architecture (Problems)

```
vendor_connectors/
â”œâ”€â”€ meshy/              # API client only
â”œâ”€â”€ aws/                # API client only
â”œâ”€â”€ github/             # API client only
â””â”€â”€ ai/                 # Central AI package
    â”œâ”€â”€ base.py         # ToolCategory, ToolParameter, ToolDefinition, ToolResult
    â”‚                   # ALSO: AIProvider, AIMessage, AIResponse, ToolRegistry (bloated)
    â”œâ”€â”€ connector.py    # AIConnector wrapping LangChain (unnecessary wrapper)
    â”œâ”€â”€ providers/
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ base.py           # BaseLLMProvider (wraps LangChain - why?)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ anthropic.py      # Wraps langchain-anthropic (unnecessary)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ openai.py         # Wraps langchain-openai (unnecessary)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ google.py         # etc.
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ crewai/           # Framework adapter (OK but misplaced)
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mcp/              # Framework adapter (OK but misplaced)
    â”œâ”€â”€ tools/
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ base.py           # Placeholder file
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ registry.py       # DUPLICATE ToolRegistry (also in base.py!)
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ factory.py        # Auto-generates tools from connectors
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ meshy_tools.py    # Why not in meshy/ ?
    â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ aws_tools.py      # Why not in aws/ ?
    â”‚   â””â”€â”€ ...               # Stub files for each connector
    â””â”€â”€ workflows/
        â”œâ”€â”€ builder.py        # LangGraph workflows (unnecessary abstraction)
        â””â”€â”€ nodes.py
```

### Problems:

1. **Tools are separated from their connectors** - `meshy_tools.py` should be in `vendor_connectors/meshy/`, not a central location
2. **Unnecessary LangChain wrappers** - Users can use LangChain directly; we don't need `AIConnector`, `BaseLLMProvider`, or provider wrappers
3. **Duplicate code** - Two `ToolRegistry` classes (in `base.py` and `tools/registry.py`)
4. **Confusing naming** - `connector.py` is an LLM connector, not a vendor connector
5. **Over-abstraction** - Workflows, factory patterns add complexity without value
6. **Mixed concerns** - LLM providers mixed with framework adapters in same `providers/` folder

## Proposed Architecture

```
vendor_connectors/
â”œâ”€â”€ meshy/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py      # API client (existing)
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ tools.py         # LangChain StructuredTools for Meshy
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mcp.py           # MCP server for Meshy
â”œâ”€â”€ aws/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py      # API client (existing)
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ tools.py         # LangChain StructuredTools for AWS
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mcp.py           # MCP server for AWS
â”œâ”€â”€ github/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py      # API client (existing)
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ tools.py         # LangChain StructuredTools for GitHub
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ mcp.py           # MCP server for GitHub
â”œâ”€â”€ [other connectors...]
â”‚
â””â”€â”€ _shared/             # Minimal shared utilities (optional)
    â””â”€â”€ tool_types.py    # ToolParameter, ToolResult if truly needed
```

### Benefits:

1. **Self-contained connectors** - Each connector owns its API client, tools, and MCP server
2. **No unnecessary wrappers** - Users use LangChain directly with our tools
3. **Clear imports** - `from vendor_connectors.meshy.tools import Text3DGenerateTool`
4. **Easier maintenance** - Changes to Meshy tools don't affect AWS
5. **Optional AI deps per connector** - `pip install vendor-connectors[meshy-ai]`

## Implementation Plan

### Phase 1: Move tools to connectors
- [ ] Move `ai/tools/meshy_tools.py` â†’ `meshy/tools.py`
- [ ] Move MCP provider logic â†’ `meshy/mcp.py`
- [ ] Update imports and entry points
- [ ] Add tests alongside each connector

### Phase 2: Remove unnecessary wrappers
- [ ] Delete `ai/connector.py` (AIConnector)
- [ ] Delete `ai/providers/base.py` (BaseLLMProvider)
- [ ] Delete `ai/providers/anthropic.py`, `openai.py`, `google.py`, etc.
- [ ] Delete `ai/workflows/`

### Phase 3: Consolidate remaining shared code
- [ ] Merge duplicate ToolRegistry classes
- [ ] Move truly shared types to `_shared/` or delete if unused
- [ ] Delete empty stub files (`aws_tools.py`, etc.)

### Phase 4: Clean up
- [ ] Update documentation
- [ ] Update pyproject.toml extras
- [ ] Remove ai/ package entirely or reduce to minimal shared types

## Usage After Refactor

```python
# Meshy tools for LangChain
from vendor_connectors.meshy.tools import get_tools, Text3DGenerateTool

# Use with any LangChain agent - NO wrapper needed
from langchain_anthropic import ChatAnthropic
from langgraph.prebuilt import create_react_agent

llm = ChatAnthropic(model="claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022")
tools = get_tools()
agent = create_react_agent(llm, tools)

# Meshy MCP server
from vendor_connectors.meshy.mcp import create_server, run_server
server = create_server()
run_server(server)

# CrewAI usage...

</details>



<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT SUFFIX -->

- Fixes jbcom/vendor-connectors#33

<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT TIPS -->
---

âœ¨ Let Copilot coding agent [set things up for you](https://github.com/jbcom/vendor-connectors/issues/new?title=âœ¨+Set+up+Copilot+instructions&body=Configure%20instructions%20for%20this%20repository%20as%20documented%20in%20%5BBest%20practices%20for%20Copilot%20coding%20agent%20in%20your%20repository%5D%28https://gh.io/copilot-coding-agent-tips%29%2E%0A%0A%3COnboard%20this%20repo%3E&assignees=copilot) â€” coding agent works faster and does higher quality work when set up for your repo.

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> Adds Meshy E2E tests for LangChain, CrewAI, and Strands using shared runners, updates model/tool tests (ArtStyle now realistic/sculpture), and splits tox into unit vs E2E environments with required env vars.
> 
> - **Tests (Meshy)**:
>   - **E2E suite**: Add reusable runners (`tests/e2e/meshy/runners.py`) and framework-specific tests for LangChain, CrewAI, and Strands (incl. Bedrock variant), with VCR cassettes and `conftest.py` for fixtures and key filtering.
>   - **Unit tests**: New comprehensive tests for `vendor_connectors.meshy.tools` (all 8 tools, framework adapters, and auto-detection).
>   - **Models**: Update expectations for `ArtStyle` to only `"realistic"` and `"sculpture"`; adjust `Text3DRequest` tests (PBR disabled for sculpture).
> - **Tooling**:

## Summary

Establishes clean language separation between repositories:

| Repository | Language | Purpose |
|------------|----------|---------|
| `agentic-crew` | Python only | Crew orchestration, framework decomposition |
| `agentic-control` | TypeScript only | Fleet management, crew invocation via CLI |

## Changes

### Removed
- `python/` directory (migrated to [agentic-crew](https://github.com/jbcom/agentic-crew))

### Added
- `src/crews/crew-tool.ts` - TypeScript interface to invoke agentic-crew CLI
- `src/crews/types.ts` - Type definitions matching agentic-crew JSON output
- `src/crews/index.ts` - Module exports

## CrewTool Usage

```typescript
import { CrewTool } from 'agentic-control';

const crewTool = new CrewTool();

// List available crews
const crews = await crewTool.listCrews();

// Run a crew
const result = await crewTool.invokeCrew({
  package: 'otterfall',
  crew: 'game_builder',
  input: 'Create a QuestComponent',
});
```

### As a Vercel AI Tool

```typescript
import { tool } from 'ai';
import { z } from 'zod';

const crewTool = new CrewTool();

export const invokeCrewTool = tool({
  description: 'Delegate a task to a specialized AI crew',
  parameters: z.object({
    package: z.string(),
    crew: z.string(),
    input: z.string(),
  }),
  execute: async ({ package: pkg, crew, input }) => {
    const result = await crewTool.invokeCrew({ package: pkg, crew, input });
    if (!result.success) throw new Error(result.error);
    return result.output;
  },
});
```

## Architecture

## Supersedes

- #3 (feat/crew-tool-integration) - Consolidated here without python/ dependency
- #6 (feat/docker-sandbox) - Closed, Docker belongs in separate scope
- #7 (copilot/docker-sandbox) - Consolidated Dockerfile changes can be re-added later

## Closes

- #8 (scope clarification) - This PR implements the clean separation

## Related

- agentic-crew#10 - External integration documentation
- agentic-crew#11 - Single-agent sandbox runners (future)

## Test Plan

- [ ] TypeScript compiles successfully
- [ ] CrewTool can invoke `agentic-crew list --json`
- [ ] CrewTool can invoke `agentic-crew run ... --json`
- [ ] Exports work correctly from package

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Introduces a TypeScript CrewTool to invoke the external agentic-crew CLI, adds Ollama as a supported AI provider, updates exports, and enhances sandbox execution and tests.
> 
> - **Crews Integration**:
>   - **`src/crews/crew-tool.ts`**: New `CrewTool` with `list`, `info`, and `invokeCrew` via safe subprocess (`spawn`) with timeouts and error handling (`CrewToolError`).
>   - **`src/crews/types.ts`**: Zod-validated types/schemas for config and crew invocation; result/metadata types.
>   - **`src/crews/index.ts`**: Exports `CrewTool` and related types.
> - **Core**:
>   - **Providers**: Add `ollama` support in `PROVIDER_CONFIG`, dynamic import, special baseURL/headers handling; extend `SupportedProvider`; `getDefaultApiKeyEnvVar('ollama')`.
>   - **Exports**: Reorganize and expand `src/core/index.ts` (including validation, subprocess, errors); minor formatting/consistency updates.
>   - **Security/Subprocess/Errors/Validation**: Safer logging and argument validation; typed error classes maintained; minor robustness improvements.
> - **Sandbox**:
>   - **Executor**: Parallel fleet execution (`executeFleet`) and structured output parsing.
>   - **Container/Runtime**: Consistent args/env handling; small reliability tweaks.
> - **Public API**:
>   - **`src/index.ts`**: Re-export crews module; tidy other exports.
> - **CLI**:
>   - Minor UX/formatting tweaks and summary calculation in fleet run output.
> - **Tests**:
>   - Add comprehensive `tests/production-release.test.ts` covering build purity, typings, subprocess safety, config validation, and docs presence.

content.body:
## Summary

Ports valuable Rivermarsh-specific game systems from the pre-kiro otterfall codebase (`archive/pre-kiro-migration` branch) to the working Kiro foundation.

## Changes

### Mobile Input System
- **VirtualJoysticks**: nipplejs-based touch joystick for character movement
- **MobileActionButtons**: Touch buttons for jump/interact/attack actions
- **GyroscopeCamera**: Device orientation-based camera with pinch-to-zoom
- **useControlsStore**: Zustand store managing all input state

### Game State & UI
- **useRivermarsh**: Complete game state store including:
  - Player stats, skills (8 skill types), inventory, equipment
  - Quest system with objectives tracking
  - NPC management and dialogue system
  - Faction reputation (5 factions)
  - localStorage persistence

- **GameUI**: Full UI overlay with:
  - Health/stamina/XP progress bars
  - Inventory panel (I key)
  - Quest log (Q key)
  - NPC dialogue boxes

- **OtterNPC + NPCManager**: NPC system with:
  - Multiple types: friendly, hostile, merchant, quest_giver, neutral
  - AI behaviors: wandering, player tracking (hostile)
  - Visual: health bars, name tags, interact prompts
  - Initial NPC spawning (Elder Moss, Trader Pebble, raiders, etc.)

## Test Plan

- [ ] Verify mobile joystick input works on touch devices
- [ ] Test gyroscope camera on mobile
- [ ] Check inventory/quest UI toggles
- [ ] Verify NPC spawning and dialogue
- [ ] Test game state persistence across sessions

## Related

- Closes #3 (Audit pre-kiro otterfall code for missing features)
- Blocked: #1 (agentic-crew integration)
- Blocked: #2 (strata integration)

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Introduces a persisted Rivermarsh game state with quests/inventory/dialogue, a HUD/UI overlay, otter NPCs with simple AI and spawning, and mobile controls (virtual joysticks, action buttons, gyroscope camera).
> 
> - **Game State (Zustand, persisted)**
>   - Adds `useRivermarsh` store with player stats/skills, inventory/equipment, quests/objectives, dialogue flow, faction reputation, and NPC management (`spawnNPC`, `damageNPC`, `removeNPC`).
> - **UI Overlay**
>   - Adds `GameUI` with `StatsDisplay`, inventory (`I`), quest log (`Q`), and dialogue box (Enter/Space to advance, Esc to close).
> - **NPC System**
>   - Adds `OtterNPC` with basic AI (wandering; hostile pursuit/attack range), nameplates, health bars, and interact prompts.
>   - Adds `NPCManager` to spawn initial NPCs (e.g., `Elder Moss`, `Trader Pebble`, raiders, friendlies).
> - **Mobile Controls**
>   - Adds `VirtualJoysticks` (nipplejs) for movement, `MobileActionButtons` (jump/interact/attack), and `GyroscopeCamera` with pinch-to-zoom.
>   - Adds `useControlsStore` for movement/camera/actions with optional debug logging.
> - **Exports**
>   - Index exports for `components/game`, `components/mobile`, and `stores`.
>

content.body:
## Overview

The pre-kiro otterfall codebase (archived at `jbcom/otterfall` branch `archive/pre-kiro-migration`) contains game development work that was never integrated into the current Kiro-based implementation.

## Source

- Repository: https://github.com/jbcom/otterfall
- Branch: `archive/pre-kiro-migration`
- Structure: `client/` based frontend

## Known Content

The pre-kiro code has:
- `client/src/` - React frontend with different component architecture
- `python/` - Crew agents and mesh toolkit
- `shared/` - Shared backend code
- `server/` - Backend server

### Components to Audit

From `client/src/components/`:
- `AdvancedWater.tsx`
- `MarshlandTerrain.tsx`
- `RivermarshGame.tsx`
- `ProceduralDungeon.tsx`
- `OtterNPC.tsx`
- `HITLReviewControls.tsx`
- Mobile input components (VirtualJoysticks, MobileActionButtons, GyroscopeCamera)
- Full UI component library (shadcn-based)

### ECS to Audit

From `client/src/ecs/`:
- Component-based architecture with separate files per component
- Entity factories
- Species loaders

### Python to Audit

From `python/`:
- `crew_agents/` - CrewAI implementations
- `mesh_toolkit/` - Meshy AI SDK integration

## Tasks

- [ ] Create `feat/rivermarsh-beta` branch
- [ ] Review pre-kiro `client/src/components/` for valuable features
- [ ] Review pre-kiro ECS architecture for improvements
- [ ] Review pre-kiro Python code for crew implementations
- [ ] Adapt and port valuable features to current architecture
- [ ] Do NOT port: anything that conflicts with strata plans

## Notes

- The pre-kiro code never fully worked
- Current Kiro-based code is the working foundation
- Goal is to identify and adapt MISSING features, not wholesale replacement
